intro: Hibbertia vestita var. thymifolia, commonly known as the thyme-leaved hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its hairy, woody stems and small, clustered flowers. The leaves are aromatic, with a scent reminiscent of thyme, giving the plant its common name. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in coastal regions. The plant produces yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators.
